sentence.Network_en: I added a dollop of vanilla ice-cream to the pie.

sentence.Network_en: Mr Putin's speech contained a large dollop of self - serving anti - American cant.
sentence.Network_cn: 普京的演讲中包含着大量自私的 反 美言辞.

the cook with his carroty head is begging us to eat ; he beckons with his ladle to every one that passes , and spoons him out a great dollop .长着一头黄红色头发的炊事员使劲地请求我们去消灭他的食物，他挥动着长柄勺子招呼着每个经过他那儿的人，并且舀出一大勺分给那些需要的人。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (denoting a clump of grass or weeds in a field): perhaps of Scandinavian origin and related to Norwegian dialect dolp 'lump'

entry.tran: (软食或黏食的)一团，一勺，一块
entry.def: A dollop of soft or sticky food is a large spoonful of it.
